moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 h6: A secondary move, probably to avoid the main theory.
moves.4. O-O Nf6 5. d4: The white open immediately the centre due that the black king has still to castle and the black bishop is still on f8.
moves.5... exd4 6. e5: A tipycal move in this kind of position.
moves.6... Ng4: A mistake not seen by both players. After h3 the black lose a piece.
moves.7. Re1 Bb4 8. Bd2 a5 9. Bxb4: Alternative variation: 9. h3 [ and the white is a piece up]
moves.9... axb4 10. Nxd4: A mistake. After Qh4 there is a double attack on h2 and f2, and the white cannot defend both.
moves.10... O-O: Alternative variation: 10... Qh4 11. h3 Qxf2+ 12. Kh1 Ne3 13. Rxe3 Qxe3
moves.11. Qxg4 d6:
The White is a piece up, but it is possible to get back the piece by d5!, due that there is a double attack to the queen and the bishop.
Alternative variation: 11... d5 12. Qf4 Nxd4 13. Qxd4 dxc4
moves.12. Qd1 Nxe5 13. Bf1: A safe place for the bishop leaving the e file free for the rook.
moves.13... Qf6 14. c3 c5 15. Nf3 Bg4 16. Be2: Any exchange helps White, due that is a piece up, and there is not any risk of counterplay.
moves.17... dxe5 18. Qc2 Bf5 19. Qb3 Qc6 20. c: With the idea to get counterplay pushing the pawns, and to find a better place for the bishop (c4) and the knight (c3).
moves.22... b6 23. Bc4 Re7 24. Nc3: The planned set-up is reached, now the White has to find a way to exploit the piece up.
moves.24... Bc2 25. Qa2 Red7 26. a5 Ra7 27. a6: Now the black rooks need  to take care of the possible advance of the a6 pawn.
moves.27... Qf5 28. Rad1: Probably not the best move, but the bishop on c2 is a strong piece limiting white's activity.
moves.28... Bxd1 29. Rxd1 Rxd1+: Probably it was better to not exchange the rook. Black lose the rook pair, the control of the d file and now the knight and bishop are stronger than the rook that has to be care of the a6 pawn.
moves.30. Nxd1 Qc2 31. Ne3 Qc1+ 32. Nf1 Qf4 33: White is totally winning. The black rook cannot move, and the a6 pawn is strong. There is not any possible defence.
